title: Minister holds discussions with Russian Embassy and Russian Aeroflot
body_lines: Discussions were held with the Russian Embassy and Russian Aeroflot in connection with the detention of an Aeroflot plane at the Bandaranaike airport, Ports, Shipping and Aviation Minister Nimal Siripala de Silva said.
He said the matter was due to an issue between the Russian Aeroflot Airlines and another company.

The Aeroflot Airbus A330, which had arrived from Moscow on Thursday was not allowed to return following an order from Colombo Commercial Court. The flight was due to return to Moscow with nearly 200 people on board.
The Minister said that he had informed the Russian embassy that the Sri Lanka government could not interfere in the judicial process and that the Russian Embassy is aware of this situation.
The minister said that he has informed the Russian Aeroflot that he would report the matter to the court tomorrow and that he hoped to release the aircraft.
The Minister also expressed his condolences to the crew and passengers of the aircraft.
Meanwhile, Aeroflot Airlines Airbus A330-300 which arrived from Moscow to take back 275 Russians in Colombo, departed at the Bandaranaike International Airport this afternoon.
